00570 struct aiMaterialProperty
00571 {
00575     C_STRUCT aiString mKey;
00576 
00581     unsigned int mSemantic;
00582 
00586     unsigned int mIndex;
00587 
00591     unsigned int mDataLength;
00592 
00600     C_ENUM aiPropertyTypeInfo mType;
00601 
00605     char* mData;
00606 
00607 #ifdef __cplusplus
00608 
00609     aiMaterialProperty()
00610         : mSemantic( 0 )
00611         , mIndex( 0 )
00612         , mDataLength( 0 )
00613         , mType( aiPTI_Float )
00614         , mData( NULL )
00615     {
00616     }
00617 
00618     ~aiMaterialProperty()   {
00619         delete[] mData;
00620     }
00621 
00622 #endif
00623 };
00625 
00626 #ifdef __cplusplus
00627 } // We need to leave the "C" block here to allow template member functions

01366     const C_STRUCT aiMaterial* pMat,
01367     const char* pKey,
01368     unsigned int type,
01369     unsigned int index,
01370     ai_real* pOut,
01371     unsigned int* pMax);

01374 #ifdef __cplusplus
01375 
01376 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
01394 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
01395 inline aiReturn aiGetMaterialFloat(const aiMaterial* pMat,
01396     const char* pKey,
01397     unsigned int type,
01398     unsigned int index,
01399     ai_real* pOut)
01400 {
01401     return aiGetMaterialFloatArray(pMat,pKey,type,index,pOut,(unsigned int*)0x0);
01402 }
01403 
01404 #else
01405 
01406 // Use our friend, the C preprocessor
01407 #define aiGetMaterialFloat (pMat, type, index, pKey, pOut) \
01408     aiGetMaterialFloatArray(pMat, type, index, pKey, pOut, NULL)
01409 
01410 #endif
